text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with shrimp and pasta shell salad
that's right I like a macaroni salad
just as much as the next guy not on the
Paleo diet when I want to make that
salad just a little extra special
nothing does the trick like some small
sweet shrimp so that's what we're going
to do here this is one of my favorite
summer salads and oh so easy so step one
here we're going to prep our dressing
always a good idea when you're doing a
cold potato or pasta salad do your
dressing ahead of time so we're going to
start with mayonnaise as the base we're
going to throw in a spoon of Dijon
mustard or any mustard you have access
to and then just a little bit of ketchup
for a little touch of acidity and a tiny
bit of color we're also going to add a
few drops of Worcester sauce some salt
and a little bit of cayenne and yes for
me that's a little of course that's up
to you you are the boss of how big
little is but you should put some in
there and after the cayenne ization
we're going to go ahead and squeeze in
the juice of one lemon you're going to
need some acidity if you want to use
vinegar of course you can but lemon just
a natural pairing with the shrimp and
then we're going to put in a whole bunch
of freshly chopped dill also known as my
second favorite herb with shrimp a new
longtime viewers probably know that
tarragon is my all-time favorite seafood
herb but dill is fantastic in this very
traditional so we're going with dill
this time but you could use tarragon or
a combination at that point the
dressings done we're going to take a
whisk and we're going to mix that up and
once that's thoroughly combined just go
ahead and put that in the fridge until
the rest of your salad ingredients are
prepped which is not going to take long
of course we're going to have to boil
some pasta shells so I'm put on a big
pot of water on high heat and we're
going to salt it thoroughly huge rookie
mistake when making pasta or macaroni
salad not salting the water enough all
right the Italian sage should taste like
seawater and by Italians I'm talking
about my wife Michelle she always says
that in fact she will actually taste the
water with a spoon I love when she does
that so you need way more than a pinch
you need a big old spoon of salt in
there and once that comes to a boil
we're going to dump in our pasta shells
and you're going to cook them all the
way don't undercook your pasta if you're
making a salad it won't have a nice
texture so cook it the full time after
which we're going to drain it and then
we're going to do something we almost
never do we're going to rinse it a
little bit I'm just going to spray this
with cold water for about 10 seconds I
just want to take away most that heat
it's okay if it's warm
don't want it hot when we mix it with
the dressing so just rinse it for a few
seconds and then just let it sit there
and drain while we prep our shrimp and I
had one pound of these beautiful pink
shrimp all right these are the hundred
to a pound size these are not bay shrimp
which is what you traditionally use for
this salad bay shrimp about half the
size so what I'm going to do is cut
these in half I think it's worth a
couple minutes investment in time to cut
those up a little bit it's just going to
mix into the salad much better if you
don't want to do it by all means skip
this step but I'm going to cut them up
but I'm doing them exactly in half you
don't have to be so careful if you just
wanted to take a knife and rough chop
them that would work or cut a bunch at
once that would work or you can't really
screw up this part okay so cut them
don't cut them whatever at that point
we're going to transfer our now fully
drained pasta shells into a mixing bowl
along with the shrimp
of course it's illegal to make a pasta
salad in the US without adding diced
celery so we got to add some of that I'm
also going to add a nice fine dice of
red bell pepper alright it's going to
add some nice bitter sweetness and also
some beautiful color and then we're
going to pour in our already made
dressing and give that a thorough mixing
and I mean thorough see if you just mix
it for a minute or two you're going to
have pasta shells that are not coated
with the sauce in fact I want a more
than coated I want that sauce going
inside the shell so I really want you to
spatulate that quite thoroughly and once
you are confident that's perfectly mixed
we're going to go ahead and throw some
plastic on it and throw it in the fridge
for at least two or three hours you
really want to let this sit soak up that
dressing soak up those flavors before
the final seasoning and final adjusting
okay so we're going to wrap it up put in
the fridge for a few hours this is what
mine look like where I take the spatula
give it a nice mix and we're going to
check for a couple things seasoning
obviously but we're also going to check
to see if we might need more mayo and
usually does need another little spoon
but I was kind of surprised mine seemed
to be perfect so I didn't add any and I
moved on to the tasting and adjusting of
the seasonings and I decided I wanted a
little more lemon a little more salt and
a little more cayenne and as you well
know we always want to season at the
temperature we're going to serve the
food so that's why I'm going to do the
final adjustments at this point so some
lemon some cayenne some salts we're
going to give that one last mix and
we're ready to serve that's it
shrimp and pasta shell salad you could
do this as a side dish you can throw it
on some greens and make a lunch out of
it
you can garnish with a little bit of
paprika or cayenne it'll give it that
little shellfish blush by the way if
you're looking for a name for your
Garageband shellfish blush you could do
worse and last but not least maybe a
little sprig of dill all right make it
nice there you go and that my friends is
a beautiful and very simple seafood
salad and as you can see I kept mine
fairly basic there's lots of stuff you
could add to this some people like to
put onions capers olives
who said bacon good call that would be
delicious and also you didn't hear this
from me but this is a base for a piece
of grilled salmon just beautiful but
bottom line just a really simple and
delicious salad to make just make sure
your water salted your pastas not
undercooked and you let it sit for a few
hours before finishing it up all right
so I really hope you give this a try
head over to food wishes comm for all
the agreement amounts and more info as
usual and as always enjoy
